main event: On 9 November 1962, a bright star-like object was observed in Concord, Vermont, with a long trail resembling a shooting star.
interesting points: The object was yellow-blue in color and observed for 10 seconds,The object fell from North to South in an elliptic path,The weather was clear during the sighting,There was speculation about the nature of the object being a meteor or a balloon,The observation was made via ground radar and visually confirmed.
witness description: Mr. George A. from Concord, Mass
